page.title: 08BODAFON HALL FARM
page.content: Bodafon Hall Farm is a farm of about 150 acres which specialises in{dairy farming.The pedigree herd of seventy {British Friesians }has been built up over the past fifty years by the present tenant whose family have farmed the land since 1876. All{fodder for the animals is produced on the farm; grazing during the summer months and silage during the winter months when the cattle have free access to sheds for shelter from the prevailing north and north-westerly winds. {Each animal}produces an average of {5500 litres of milk per year.}This is sent to the local creamery for pasteur isation and then is mostly sent for processing. In the summer months some returns to the area as liquid milk for the large influx of tourists.
